column5: Just thought I post this, I arrived 11am at the lake today and the ice was about 14" to 16" inches solid ice.. Saw few people fishin, few ATV's and snowmobile. Anyway I fished for about 4hrs today and got few hits and lost 2 while reeling in... Alot of fish in the sonar but its hard for the to commit, very picky.. Only got one today here's the pic. http://i1105.photobu...rman/photo1.jpg http://i1105.photobu...man/photo-2.jpg  thnx to all the OFC'ers who help for the info about the lake joe ice condition I manage to go out againfor the last time...  bfisher

Was out on Saturday with three buddies we measured cloe to 24 inches of ice and it was cold and cracking and banging all day making ice We couldn't keep the trout off our lines from 8am till 430 Biggest was two pounds but slot of small ones Might get one mire weekend out there have to take tracks off atv and put fits bsck on Really good traveling either walking or atv

those crackin and bangin in the ice scared the hell out me... there was this crack very loud where  I was sitting I thought the its going to break, I got up my sit and look around I even said omg lol... 3 people lookin at me from far away and laughing.. they saw me how I reacted haha  I was embarrass after lol  on the other hand ice was good, lots of fish but its hard for them to strike they just keep following my baits... but  it was a good day.. I hope there is more ice next week so I can get back...
Nice laker bfisher Good girth on that one Thanks for sharing Leechman
What part of lake were you fishing we only saw two groups out there
I was at the middle of playfair island and birch island... It was sunday when I went... only few people I saw... it feels like nobody do ice fish that lake... lol  lucky for us lol
It can be busy on saturdays We saw three groups wear we were We got on at Gordon bay marine
I checked gordon bay but I dont know where to park so I came back to the same place where I went last yr... Not far from where you are... you planing to go back this weekend?? you think still good??

If you were between Playfair and Birch Islands, my guess is that you were parking at the CNIB camp....just wondering if you have been there a lot this year?  I've heard of people's cars getting ticketed/towed from there the last couple of years, and have been reluctant to park there myself.

last year I went there twice and this year only once... I didnt know that they ticket/towed car there, saw some cars last yr so I park there, then again this sunday.. well good to the hear news.. I would be very careful next time... I heard Gordon bay marine charge 10d for parking...
Ten dollars to park is alot cheaper than calling a taxi to go to pound and pay for car to be let go plus ticket
Depending on weather we might go back up saturday
planning to go back sunday... I hope it gets colder...  sorry guys.. I love soft water too but I kindly enjoy ice this yr... lol

I was also out there yesterday in Foot's Bay. My buddy landed two and lost a couple and I got skunked. We fished from 2-7pm. Lots of chasers but light biters, hard to get a good hook set. Will be out next weekend. The ice will hold up for sure. I seen over a dozen trucks driving around out there still. 12 to 16 inches of ice. Lake Joe has been unkind to me this season. Need to have a good outing for closure.
